candidates.description:
With his Presidential announcement in the Senate Caucus Room, the young Senator dared America to dream.

As he tours the nation, brimming with potential and virtue like no other, he feels that it will meet his dare with more vigour than ever thought possible. Though there is strife, and there is hardship, Jack Kennedy knows that when push comes to shove, the American people will choose hope, over fear - progress, over stagnation.

This belief is helped, in no small part, by his campaign's deep coffers and smooth organisation. A chain store against a sleuth of independent merchants, no campaign has the funds or cohesion to offer a serious challenge - save for Nixon's, in the general.

Democrats across the nation turn out for Kennedy, and it seems that it will be a matter of how much he can win by, with no room for ifs.

Robert Kennedy - the runt of the litter. The unfavoured child of an already cold patriarch, Robert in another life could have been a priest, or a journalist. Instead, he is a moody, aggressive pit fighter, who will do anything to continue his father's vicarious ambition for his older brother.

Equally opportunistic and progressive, Robert has been fighting for John ever since the 50s. Whether it was unseating an entrenched incumbent, working for family friend Joseph McCarthy or spying on the Stevenson campaign for 1956, everything in his life as been about making John Kennedy a winner, and proving to his uncaring father that he was not a runt.

Now Robert faces his greatest challenge yet. There can be no second place, no losing. John must beat Richard Nixon. He must become the President. He has worked too hard for too long to accept any other result.

Henry Cabot Lodge Jr. has an impeccable pedigree, a great war record, and a career that has seen him serve as a Senator and an Ambassador to the United Nations. He is a committed internationalist and a moderate in the party. He appeals to a similar wing of the party as Nelson Rockefeller, but is much more willing to be the running mate on a Nixon ticket.

questions.description: First, Jack narrowly lost the VP vote to Kefauver. Then he won the Pulitzer prize for his book. Finally, he won re-election by more than 70%. Its clear Jack is on the precipice of becoming a national icon. Jacks not interested in settling for scraps this time. Hes named you as his campaign manager, and youre eager to help. The date for his announcement has been leaked, and hes preparing for his announcement speech. What themes should Jack hit?

answers.description: Youre here to win it Jack. Lets not hide it. Tell them youll be the President, or nothing at all. Its not 1956 anymore, youre not a Vice-President. You win, or you lose. No second place.
answers.feedback: In a speech he of course knocked out of the park, Jack announces that he is running with the belief that he can win the nomination and election. When asked if hed accept the Vice-Presidential slot, he replies Under no circumstance.

answers.description: This election will be decided in the convention, as always. I hate it, but we need to brown nose to win. Talk about how deeply inspired you were by Roosevelt, Truman and Stevenson and how you want to continue their legacy.
answers.feedback: I believe that the Democratic Party has a historic function to perform in the winning of the 1960 election, comparable to its role in 1932 Jack says, with a firm expression. Hopefully the bosses get the memo.

questions.description: Despite being named the Democrats, the nomination process really isnt democratic. While there are a few open primaries, it will ultimately be the convention that decides Jacks fate. Should Jack run in these primaries anyway?

answers.description: No, no, no. We wont win much of anything, just waste resources and look like fools if any favorite son runs suddenly. I mean, we could lose to uncommitted in some states. That would be just humiliating. Save everything for the convention.
answers.feedback: Paul Fischer, inventor and businessman, is the shock winner of the New Hampshire primary, although Jack didnt do poorly in the write-ins. Senator Hubert Humphrey announces his intentions to run in the upcoming primaries, and as a liberal could steal momentum from Jack, forcing you into the next races anyway.

answers.description: We should absolutely enter some, but we need to prove a point here. We can win, and we will win. We wont waste time with favorite sons, and focus on primaries where we can win, and win big.
answers.feedback: Jack wallops his only competition and sends a strong message. Its agreed that the team will focus on Wisconsin, Nebraska, Oregon, Indiana, West Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Illinois and Connecticut. But a wrench is thrown into your plans when Senator Hubert Humphrey announces hes going to enter the race...

answers.description: Absolutely we should. Jack is the star candidate, he needs to keep on shining. A dominant victory will really build up momentum for the convention, really send the message that Jack is a winner.
answers.feedback: Jack wallops his only competition, an unknown businessman named Paul Fischer. But youre going to end up competing against favorite sons burning through resources to get upsets, harming your general election odds. This is noticed by Senator Humphrey, who announces his intentions of competing in future primaries.

questions.description: The upcoming Wisconsin primary will be Jacks first real competition. Hubert Humphrey is an energetic campaigner with an extremely strong record on civil rights, unions and farmers - all very appealing to the liberals of Wisconsin. How will you block Humphrey?

answers.description: Wisconsin is a humble state. I like it, honestly, but Im sure the people here get bored. Lets wow the people, bring along the whole Kennedy family. Lets see if Sinatra has some free time in his schedule.
answers.feedback: You bring Hollywood to Wisconsin, and earn all the attention of the media. John and Jackie vs Hubert and Muriel? Its no competition at all. John wins by 15%, and the Humphrey campaign is bruised. But not out.

answers.description: Humphrey isnt a joke like Fischer. But hes broke like a joke at least. If Humphrey is spending a dollar, well spend ten. This is Jacks turn, not his.
answers.feedback: Humphrey vs Kennedy is like an independent merchant vs a chain store. This just makes the results more frustrating - Jack only wins by 10%, despite the spending difference, and with no headway into the Protestant boroughs. Humphrey is gaining momentum. He needs to be put down, and soon

answers.description: Stay calm, and stay the course. Weve been preparing for this since last year with Proxmire. Well stay the course and win. Humphrey just doesnt have the stamina.
answers.feedback: Jack does end up winning - by about 5%, and the race was only saved by Catholic boroughs. Humphrey smells blood - he isnt dropping out any time soon. '

questions.description: The next primary will be the West Virginia primary, which is as far South as youll go. This brings up the inevitable question of civil rights, not that theres much of a question. You and Jack both oppose segregation - but what should the campaigns stance be?

answers.description: We cant compromise on this, not even a little. If we compromise now, were setting ourselves up for failure when Nixon, or Rockefeller, or whoever is nominated, outflanks us and steals the negro vote. Weve got to support a full, federal, civil rights bill. Theres no compromise on it.
answers.feedback: Jack disagrees - theres plenty to compromise on with it. He advocates for a community solution to segregation. Its a politer form of states rights, and youre annoyed. But Jack explains the importance of keeping the party united for the general, and you come around. '

answers.description: Theres a middle ground between that state's rights crap and real progress, and we need to hit it. Humphrey has the diehards locked up anyway. Its better that we keep the party united for the general.
answers.feedback: This is probably for the best. The Catholicism is already controversial - you dont need to stir the point any further and make Humphrey the more tolerable candidate. '

questions.description: Its come up before, but if Jack wins, hell be the first Catholic since Al Smith in 1928 to be nominated for President - Smith nearly losing the Solid South due to his Catholicism. With West Virginia being a majority protestant state, how should we handle the Catholic issue?

answers.description: Lets just avoid it, whenever it comes up. People already know about it and have their minds made up. Well keep it about the issues. Who cares what church my brother goes to when hes gonna fix up the economy?
answers.feedback: A lot of voters, as it turns out. Humphrey wont make this an issue in the primary, but he's just about the only one. '

answers.description: I think the movement speaks for itself. We wont address it here and now, but lets collect some of the material that will be produced. Jack kissing the Popes hand, asking for orders from the Pope, that sort of thing. If we shed a light on the absurd lengths people are going to, we should bring shame to the movement.
answers.feedback: Theres some truly repulsive media collected, including some calling for the Klan to stop Jack. You manage to generate shame at least - shame for yourself as you awkwardly read off these offensive leaflets to the press.'

answers.description: Its infuriating to talk about my faith like this, but lets think of it as a scandal. The most important thing to do when a scandal pops up is to take it head on and define the narrative.
answers.feedback: I believe in an America where religious intolerance will someday end; where all men and all churches are treated as equal. Its an inspiring message - one to be used in ads in the future, and helps reduce the anti-Catholic vote. Bigots will still exist certainly, but this should make them less influential. '

questions.description: The West Virginia primary marks a critical point in the campaign. With almost no Catholics in the boroughs and a constituency made up of mostly rural farmers or union laborers, this is Humphreys strongest state. A dominant victory here could end his campaign, and a loss could blunt the momentum youve generated so far. Whats the plan for this primary?

answers.description: Were the Kennedys, he's just Hubert. He has a bus he rented to travel - we have a private plane. If Hubert spends a buck, well spend ten. No, a hundred. A thousand if we have to. Whatever it costs to make Hubert regret running.
answers.feedback: This of course eats into the warchest, but it pays off - Jack wins by 40%, an incredible result considering the odds. With Humphrey losing here, he withdraws on the same night.'

answers.description: Were here to win. That means you play nasty sometimes. I served in the war. Jack is a certified war hero. I have to ask, where was Humphrey in the war? I sure didnt see him around.
answers.feedback: This is an outright nasty attack on Humphrey. Your questions, coupled with leaflets explicitly calling him a draft dodger, seal his fate, and you win the state for Jack by 20%. Humphrey drops out of the race altogether, and dont expect an endorsement any time soon.

answers.description: Why limit ourselves to just one option? Were on the backfoot here! Bring every Kennedy to comb for votes, question Humphrey on his draft dodging and spend every cent on this race here. I dont care if we spend a million bucks, to win here, we have to win.
answers.feedback: Throwing everything at Humphrey isnt elegant, but it is effective. Humphrey is crushed, and Jack wins at an astonishing 60%. Humphrey drops out the same day.

answers.description: Its simple maths. Humphrey has less staff and less family. Well knock on as many doors as we can and get turnout with our base as high as possible. I dont care if we have to go through neighbourhoods with a fine tooth comb - were finding our voters, and were sending them to the polls and winning this damn thing.
answers.feedback: Simple, but effective. Jack wins by 30%, with barely a dent into the warchest. If Humphrey cant win here, he cant win at all. Recognising this, he drops out of the race. '

questions.description: With Humphrey dropping out, Jack should be able to breeze through the next primaries. Should be is the operative term however - Senator Wayne Morse is making a favorite son bid in Oregon, believing Jack isnt supportive of Unions. Hes gotten an endorsement from that crook James Hoffa as well, whos cited Jacks role in the LandrumGriffin Act as reason for opposition - a bill that helps unionmen, but hurts corrupt scumbags like Hoffa. Jack wants to know how this should be handled.

answers.description: Morse is a pain in the butt. How does he sleep at night, knowing exactly whos backing him? Lets just pack up, and prepare for the convention.
answers.feedback: This is a reasonable step to take. The Oregon headquarters make an admirable effort at a write-in campaign, but Morse wins 60-40. Questions are raised as to why Jack didnt make an appearance however '

answers.description: We handled Humphrey easily, and Morse is no Humphrey. Were not gonna accept this cute little stunt from Morse. Play the hits - bring the whole family, bring warchest, and drown him. He sowed the wind, let him reap the whirlwind.
answers.feedback: This is last minute - a lot of people have already made plans, and you cant get everyone involved. But you still put on enough of a show to wow the sleepy state of Oregon, and beat Morse by a solid 10%.

answers.description: The Kennedys love unions, we hate scumbags that exploit union workers - that means Hoffa. Dad has some contacts with the unions, they should be happy to elaborate.
answers.feedback: Dad is even more desperate than Jack, and pulls as many strings as he can. The United Steelworkers heartily endorse you, and George Meany of the AFL-CIO praises the Landrum-Griffin bill - it pays off to make sure you beat Morse by 20%. Still, while labor leaders are behind you, the unionmen themselves wont be enthused by a Prince candidate.

questions.description: Its July, and the convention is just days away. Lyndon Johnson, the so-called Master of the Senate, has announced he intends to run for President. His odds are poor, and he knows it, so its launching a full on offensive against Jack. Using quotes from Eleanor Roosevelt, hes attacking Jack for his softness on McCarthyism. This sunk Jacks run for Vice-President in 56 - how do we handle this?

answers.description: I mean - what if we lent into this, just a little. We could be the ultimate anti-communists, really snatch Nixons base from under him. Besides, half of Massachusetts think he was a hero - it'd just upset the base.
answers.feedback: Jack tells you, in no uncertain terms, that he will not lean into McCarthyism - certainly not during the primary. He issues a statement stressing a need to focus on external communism - a middle ground between denouncing McCarthyism and being tough on Communism.'

answers.description: Sure, the bosses may hate McCarthy. But they love labor more than they hate McCarthy, and Johnson hates labor. Slam him for being anti-union, and we ought to stay in the good books.
answers.feedback: This is a notable weakness for Johnson, and stressing it should keep delegates in your camp. Still, Lyndon Johnson isnt giving up

answers.description: There isnt a good answer here. Just ignore it, and focus on building momentum. We should win because we are winners. We just need to figure something out.
answers.feedback: Dad goes to Las Vegas, and fudges the bets to improve the odds of Jack winning. Its unorthodox certainly, but the message remains clear - Jack is a winner.

questions.description: Landslide Lyndon started with a muddy campaign, and now hes gotten truly dirty. Johnson supporters India Edwards and John Connally have questioned Jacks health, openly accusing him of having Addisons disease. How should we handle this?

answers.description: Oh, that bastard. Hes bitter because hes a loser! Hes a nobody. But this god damn attack could hurt us after we crush him. Deny it. Let's get a clean bill of health, prove it. It basically isnt true anyway, Jack is as active as any candidate.
answers.feedback: The accusations are, of course, true. But Jack is an impressive trooper, and most people dismiss this as typical campaign slander. '

answers.description: This is too far - even that fat, stupid animal has to know there are limits. Lets have people reach out to his people. Have some basic decency for crying out loud!
answers.feedback: You get no response. '

answers.description: That son of a bitch. That rat bastard! He hates us, he always has the miserable bastard! What about his heart? Or box 13? Hes a fat, dying, lying, cheat! To hell with him!
answers.feedback: He may be all of those things, but hes also personally popular with the Democratic bosses - being one himself. Jack stops you from really fighting back, and simply issues a denial. Youre frustrated by Jacks softness with Lyndon.

questions.description: The convention has arrived. Johnsons chances arrive at a deadlocked convention, so he can do as much behind the scenes wheeling dealing behind the scenes to steal the nomination from Jack. To cause the deadlock, hes rallying an Anyone but Kennedy movement with Humphrey, Adlai Stevenson, Stuart Symington, and the favorite sons to delay Jacks victory. How will you ensure an early victory?

answers.description: Humphrey is a pragmatist at heart. Can he really trust Lyndon on civil rights? Hed be stupid if he did. Im sure we can get him behind us maybe offer a cabinet job as well?
answers.feedback: Theres still some sore feelings between him and the campaign, but agrees to not take part in the Anyone but Kennedy plan.

answers.description: Symington only ever ran because Truman wanted him to. Well have a word with him, and promise him a job if he drops out and endorses us.
answers.feedback: Symington makes it clear he doesnt believe you when you offer him veep, but hes happy for a job in the administration and endorses you. '

answers.description: Ill speak with Stevenson. Daleys telling me he doesnt have a chance - he needs to understand that hes over the hill. If he doesnt drop out and endorse Jack, he is through. Ill make sure of it.
answers.feedback: Stevenson is utterly unimpressed, and continues his presidential run. But Daley is correct - Stevenson flounders entirely, and Illinois stays behind you.

answers.description: Weve already won so many contests - the party elders may not be happy, but the party delegates are behind us. Just hit the floor and keep people behind us. Weve won god damn it, and Lyndon needs to accept that.
answers.feedback: LBJ begs some of Jacks backers to vote for him on the second ballot. Hes told frankly there wont be a second ballot. Heres hoping

questions.description: It's stuffy in the overfilled convention hall as the votes are tallied. You've put in the work, and certainly the money, but you can't help but sweat in anxiety. Looking over at Jack, you find no comfort in his practiced neutrality.

answers.description: As the result of the first ballot is announced, his expression...
answers.feedback: Turns into a wide smile as a veritable sweep occurs, netting you 850 delegates. As Dad shakes your brother's hand, you can almost pretend he's proud of you. Almost.

questions.description: It's stuffy in the overfilled convention hall as the votes are tallied. You've put in the work, and certainly the money, but you can't help but sweat in anxiety. Looking over at Jack, you find no comfort in his practiced neutrality.

answers.description: As the result of the first ballot is announced, his expression...
answers.feedback: Becomes one of pure, unadulterated relief as 806 delegates cast their vote for him. You're sure he would have collapsed if it weren't for the brace holding him up. Dad shakes his hand, smiling.

questions.description: It's stuffy in the overfilled convention hall as the votes are tallied. You've put in the work, and certainly the money, but you can't help but sweat in anxiety. Looking over at Jack, you find no comfort in his practiced neutrality.

answers.description: As the result of the first ballot is announced, his expression...
answers.feedback: Softens, as 783 delegates affirm him as the Democratic nominee on the first ballot. Dad doesn't smile - he must be wondering how many millions each delegate cost.

questions.description: It's stuffy in the overfilled convention hall as the votes are tallied. You've put in the work, and certainly the money, but you can't help but sweat in anxiety. Looking over at Jack, you find no comfort in his practiced neutrality.

answers.description: As the result of the first ballot is announced, his expression...
answers.feedback: Turns almost sickly and pale as he loses the first ballot with only 750 delegates. After sinking another pill, he keeps up appearances as you and Dad secure the nomination on a disgraceful fourth ballot. Dad's furious.

questions.description: As expected, you've secured the nomination, despite any challenges - but the question of Jack's running mate, while having been discussed, lingers. Whose case will you argue?

answers.description: After the nasty primary we had, we need to unite the party. Hubert Humphrey should be our running mate. He may lose us the south, but hell unite the party and really enthrall the north.
answers.feedback: You prepare your case when you get word that while tallying up the states Jack will start with, he asked for Texas to be added. Your heart sinks when you realize what this means.

answers.description: We have issues with the labor rank and file. So that means we ought to make amends, and Walter Reuther is our best chance at that. Labor will be frothing at the mouth for us with him on our side. '
answers.feedback: You prepare your case when you get word that while tallying up the states Jack will start with, he asked for Texas to be added. Your heart sinks when you realize what this means.

answers.description: Loyalty is a rare thing in politics, and it should be rewarded. Governor Orville Freeman has been an early backer and as a founder of the Democratic-Farmer-Labor party, hell get the liberals roaring.
answers.feedback: You prepare your case when you get word that while tallying up the states Jack will start with, he asked for Texas to be added. Your heart sinks when you realize what this means.

answers.description: Symington is our guy. Hes Southern, but hes aggressively pro-civil rights and a solid liberal in general. Plus he has Trumans backing - we could get the elders on our side.
answers.feedback: You prepare your case when you get word that while tallying up the states Jack will start with, he asked for Texas to be added. Your heart sinks when you realize what this means.

questions.description: Its mid-afternoon, and Jack is practicing his acceptance speech. His grin when he sees you turns into a grimace as he realizes what your expression means. He must be crazy - after what Lyndon said about him? You must talk some sense into him.

answers.description: This is just to heal the party divide right? Were not really picking him are we? Have you planned for what he does if he says yes?
answers.feedback: Thank him profusely. Jack breaks into a grin. We need the South Bobby, there's no two ways about it.'

answers.description: Texas is one of the most antiunion states in the union! He voted for Taft-Hartley! Labor is already an issue, why are we making them angrier?
answers.feedback: We can win Labor back with policy. But the South needs regionalism, not policy. Jack says frankly.

answers.description: Jack, Jack, cmon. We dont need the South! Truman dealt with Thurmond, and he won!
answers.feedback: Truman also dealt with Dewey. Tricky Dicky is a very different kind of animal. Hell - he chuckles. Animal is too kind.

answers.description: Jack - after the Addisons thing? After what he said about dad? I mean, are you serious? Hes a beast of man! You cant actually be considering him!
answers.feedback: Its politics Bobby, not personal. Jack says matter of factly. We need the South, and he wins the South. '

questions.description: Theres nothing else for it. Youll have to talk Lyndon himself out of taking the nomination. When you enter his hotel room, he greets you with a big wide grin. How are ya, Robert? You must be proud. Bastard.

answers.description: Have some common sense Lyndon. You got an offer you were supposed to refuse. Neither me nor Jack want you on the ticket.
answers.feedback: Tough tittys. Im staying on the ticket. He passes on the first ballot - unions are outraged. Meany calls Johnson the arch-foe of labor. The idea that Kennedy made chumps out of leaders of American labor is becoming a common one.

answers.description: Lyndon, Ill ask you frankly - you want to be bored out of your mind in the Vice-President's seat, or you want to still be the Master of the Senate? Just think about it.
answers.feedback: Johnsons grin drops, and he glares. Hes dropped out in the hour, and Jack is furious. The emergency running mate Henry Jackson of Washington is chosen, offering absolutely nothing to the South opposed to Catholicism, Civil Rights, or both. Hopefully they back a third party instead of Nixon '

answers.description: Ill be blunt Lyndon, this is a booby prize. Jack and I have zero intention of keeping you involved in affairs. Honestly, we were considering Stevenson - a little place for retirement, more than anything else.
answers.feedback: Oh, Ill find ways to keep busy. He passes on the first ballot - unions are outraged. Meany calls Johnson the arch-foe of labor. The idea that Kennedy made chumps out of leaders of American labor is becoming a common one.

answers.description: Lyndon, you know how I feel about you. We cant have a campaign where the manager and the number 2 guy hate each other.
answers.feedback: You could be fucking Khrushchev for all I care. Im sticking onto the ticket. He passes on the first ballot - unions are outraged. Meany calls Johnson the arch-foe of labor. The idea that Kennedy made chumps out of leaders of American labor is becoming a common one.

questions.description: Jacks acceptance speech was, as expected, incredible. Were going to be using it for ads, but which part should we highlight in particular?

answers.description: The new frontier, the series of challenges we're going to face together. Offering challenges instead of promises will make a big difference from the Fair Deal and New Deal.
answers.feedback: Its certainly a bold form of advertising. But Jack delivers the speech beautifully, with enough passion to make even the most ardent cynic's heart soar with pride.

answers.description: Civil rights has been part of the Democratic agenda since the 40s, and it made it onto the plank again. Well stress Jacks commitment to ensuring all men are treated fairly, black or white.
answers.feedback: This is a solid ad that should energize the northern liberals, enrage the solid south. But the Republicans still have a solid portion of the black vote for now

answers.description: I know what the bosses are saying - that Jack is too young? Its just not true. Lets emphasize the young leadership needed to address the changing world we find ourselves in.
answers.feedback: Eisenhowers aloof style of leadership, coupled with his infamous heart attack in 1955, the demand for more energetic leadership is palpable. This appeal should be a good, non-political way of appealing to the maximum number of people.

questions.description: Richard Nixon has been nominated, with only the most token of resistance put up by Nelson Rockefeller. Nixon is at least tolerated by the majority of the Republican party, but the same cannot be said of old enemy Henry Cabot Lodge. Despite depressing conservatives, Lodges experience in diplomacy helps cement the Republican domination of foreign policy - is it worth engaging with them on this front?

answers.description: Its insane that the Republicans are the foreign policy party. Theyve failed nearly completely in all foreign policy tasks - I think it would be silly not to stress our own focus on foreign policy.
answers.feedback: Its true that the Republicans havent handled foreign policy as well as they claim. Cuba, the missile gap, the collapse of the Paris summit. Theres plenty to criticize, and Jack has plenty of assertive answers for questions on how he would fix Ikes many mistakes.

answers.description: The idea that foreign policy and domestic policy are different is absurd. We need to tie everything together - we won the second world war on liberalism, its an effective tactic.
answers.feedback: America is an example to every nation. It simply must advocate for a liveable wage, equal civil rights and liberal fiscal policy! Its an effective pitch, but Nixon is doing the same thing, mitigating the effect somewhat.

answers.description: The days of isolationism are over. Im sure that drives dad nuts, but its true. At the same time, we should remain focused on domestic issues, where we have the leg up. We obviously have the answers available for people that ask, but we should keep focus on where we have the advantage.
answers.feedback: Its always a poor idea to let your opponent define a narrative Bobby. You should know this - John does at least. He synthsies his domestic policy with foreign policy implications, calling for teachers to be paid more as theyre a critical bulwark in the war against communism. Nixon does similar, and the effect is marginal on both sides as a result.

questions.description: During his acceptance speech, Nixon promised to visit every state in the union - a critical mistake that has him wasting his time in the Plains and Hawaii while you can hypertarget a key swing area. Where should the campaign focus?

answers.description: The East Coast is worth defending. With Lodge on his ticket, Nixon could really make some headway - and hell, taking Massachusetts from Lodge again would feel great.
answers.feedback: Most of the East is safe, but there are some valuable states worth defending. Jack trusts your judgment here.

answers.description: The Midwest, of course. We need to keep the union workers happy, and theyre all worth an incredible amount of electoral votes altogether.
answers.feedback: Keeping the Midwest happy will almost certain guarantee victory, but dont get too distracted - the West Coast and Border states are valuable as well.

answers.description: The South is a key region. They have some of the worst poverty in America today, and Ikes done not a damn thing to address. Neither will Nixon - Jack has got to go.
answers.feedback: A soon to be famous photo of Jack talking to a father and his children is taken, as the campaign is horrified by the rural poverty. Everyone knew the stats, but to see it in person

answers.description: The West Coast is vital. California alone could decide the election, but Oregon and Washington could add up to some very valuable states.
answers.feedback: Jack was already good at going Hollywood - this just proves it. You tolerate Sinatra as he continues to shower Jack with glamor.

questions.description: The Kennedy dynasty have been enthusiastic campaigners for Jack for his whole career - except you. Youve always focused on keeping the operation running behind the scenes, and avoiding too much public attention. Given the stakes of the election, will you change your standard operations?

answers.description: Im not a speaker, I dont think I ever will be. But I know labor, Ive worked with them before. Lets just keep reassuring union bosses that well only go after the corrupt union bosses - theyre not Hoffa, they should have nothing to fear.
answers.feedback: You need to keep them happy, and this should do just that. Some do still seem nervous when you talk about only going after dirty ones

answers.description: We need all hands on deck. Ill help with some stump speeches, help build the crowd up before the men on the ticket speak. Theres no such thing as too much help.
answers.feedback: You have a natural talent in speaking - you also have almost no experience in speaking. Your speeches are mediocre but never bad. Perhaps one day youll be a truly great speaker.

answers.description: I would rather avoid speaking, frankly. Jack is the speaker, Im the manager. We work like that for a reason. Lets keep the coffers overflowing, talk to as many donors as we can.
answers.feedback: Theres no such thing as too much money. The extra cash to burn will help to a minor but notable degree.

questions.description: A key argument Nixon has been making is that of experience - as the Vice-President, he was intimately involved with the decisions Eisenhower made, and will continue the still popular Presidents legacy. How will you address Nixons greatest strength?

answers.description: Was Nixon critical to Ikes decision to lose Cuba to communists? Or was it falling behind in the space race? Was he the one to advise Ike to build less missiles then the Soviets? Let Nixon be experienced in his screw ups - we need someone else.
answers.feedback: Eisenhower isnt as incredibly popular as he was in 1952, but he is still very popular. Straw polls show people dont like Jacks overly negative attitude against Eisenhower - but the attacks do stick.

answers.description: Everyone knows the Vice-President doesnt do a damn thing. Who is Nixon fooling? Even Eisenhower said as much. While Nixon was going on vacations in South America, Jack was actually legislating. If anything, hes the experienced one. Not Dick Nixon! Dont let him and trick people!
answers.feedback: Jack hits back on the experience claim, pointing this accomplishments and the infamous If you gave me a week answer when Ike was asked how Nixon helped. Ike clarifies that he was joking - and if the Vice-President isnt qualified, what does that make Jack? More qualified, but the public arent biting. '

answers.description: I was watching some of those old Ike commercials. Can you believe people liked that stuff? Anyway, in every commercial he would face the camera and say Its time for a change!. Wouldnt it be funny to use that against him?
answers.feedback: Do you want a man for president whos seasoned through and through? But not so doggone seasoned he wont try something new? Redirecting Nixons experience into being stale is a novel approach.

questions.description: Jacqueline Kennedy hasnt been campaigning much, due to a pregnancy. However, she has endorsed a proposal from staffer Carlos McCormick to generate minority turnout through a series of programs called the Viva Kennedy Campaign. These would include clubs to help register voters and commercials recorded in Spanish by Jackie. Is this a wise use of resources?

answers.description: Thats a good idea - these ideas could improve our margins in California and Texas. And besides, its not like our resources are all that limited. Lets get some cameras in.
answers.feedback: Votar democrtica - votar por Kennedy! The Mexican-Americans have been neglected for so long simply acknowledging them will go a long way to winning them over.

answers.description: Im thankful for Jackies enthusiasm - Jack is lucky to have you. But considering our civil rights support, our welfare policies and our Catholicism combined with issues like the poll taxes, I think theres a better use of resources. Still, you have a great appeal - how about we record some ads with you and Jack?
answers.feedback: Jacqueline is a charismatic and glamorous woman, and some ads with Jack being the happy family help boost his already high approval rating.

questions.description: While Jack will run on a liberal economic platform, theres debate on what part he should focus on. Some say he needs to energize the Unions as best he can, while others think generating turnout from the poor is the best bet. Others still argue that focusing on a promise to cut taxes and raise spending is the best bet. Bearing in mind Jack will talk about all of these elements, which should be the central focus?

answers.description: Its simple. A promise to keep taxes low and subsidies high are both popular policies, so it seems like a no-brainer that we highlight that part of our policy.
answers.feedback: The unspoken part of this is that youll be deficit spending, a controversial act to say the least. A lot of Americans are made uneasy by the idea, but Nixons warnings about inflation dont really take off either.

answers.description: If anyone says weve pandered too much to labor, fire them. We can never appeal to labor too much. Highlight our support for Unions and intent on repealing Taft-Hartley.
answers.feedback: Unionmen take notice, as do those opposed to union overreach. This should help Jack on balance, at least.

answers.description: Theres a desperate poverty in this nation we need to take steps to address. Lets focus on our most popular policies, like healthcare for the elderly, a raise to the minimum wage and increase funds for education.
answers.feedback: Nixon can finger wag about inflation all he wants - these are all very popular proposals, especially when Jack markets them as helping in the Cold War.

questions.description: For the first time in a hundred years, the presidential candidates are going to debate. Nixon has campaign plans just a few hours from the campaign in Illinois. Should Jack operate a counter campaign, or focus on preparing for the debates?

answers.description: If we lose Illinois, we lose period. We have Daley and the whole Illinois Democratic party on our side. If we cant practice for the debates as much, so be it. Illinois is worth it.
answers.feedback: Jack has a grand parade set up by Daley, and puts on a hell of a show. But when it comes time for the debates, hes clearly exhausted and in agony even after his painkillers. Nixon is considered the winner.

answers.description: Nixon was a champion debater. Jack will practice with me, and well arrive early at WBBM and let our surrogates campaign in Chicago. We may fall behind in Illinois, but the debates will be in every state. It's clear which is more important.
answers.feedback: Nixon gets headlines in local papers, but looks sick and unhealthy after a long day campaigning. His suit blends in with the background, and his voice is tired and quiet. Jack crushes Nixon.

questions.description: Eisenhower has been campaigning enthusiastically for Nixon in New York, Ohio and Pennsylvania. While his popularity has been lagging, he is still enormously popular. How can we adapt to this development?

answers.description: Hell. Hell! If hes going to dominate the Midwest, then we just need to adapt. Lets go into overdrive in the West Coast.
answers.feedback: For whatever reason Eisenhower stops campaigning after just a few weeks. But the damage is done in those areas.

answers.description: Damn it. The one time he works, and its to ruin our race. Theres nothing else for it, we got to put in the elbow grease and make sure we offset his efforts.
answers.feedback: The campaign works as hard as it can offsetting the balance, before Eisenhower stops campaigning for whatever reason. But the national effort has suffered as a result.

questions.description: Martin Luther King recently committed the crime of sitting in a restaurant - hes set to serve 6 months of hard labor for this crime. Nixon, despite prior endorsements from Jackie Robinson and Kings father, has remained silent on the arrest. Some in your campaign are advising that you make a call to Coretta King.

answers.description: Its frustrating, but I dont think theres much to gain here from putting ourselves in this mess. Jack should call Governor Vandiver and Ill have a word with the Judge - its abominable what Dr. King is going though.
answers.feedback: Jack, despite your advice, calls Coretta anyway. In a simple 90 second call, he tells her hes sorry for whats happening and hell help her however he can. It makes front page news, and when King is released, he all but directly endorses Jack. Hopefully thats worth the backlash

answers.description: We absolutely cannot call Coretta King. What she's going through is awful, but an outright phone call is just a political loss. Its simply out of the question. Still, Jack should speak with Governor Vandiver. Its just an outrage that Dr. King is suffering through this.
answers.feedback: Wofford and Shriver pressure Jack as best they can, but at your insistence, Jack doesnt budge. King is released early thanks to your influence and thanks Jack for his efforts.

questions.description: An odd matter has been brought to your attention. A few Bishops in Puerto Rico of all places have released a letter, telling Catholics to not vote for a man opposed to the church. While this refers to the election of Puerto Rican Governor, the campaign is concerned that this will make Catholicism an issue again.

answers.description: Just - just wait a minute. See what people say. Dont jump the gun. Ill prepare Jack some statements denouncing the whole thing, but otherwise well wait.
answers.feedback: You wait, but nothing comes of the matter. Either Nixon doesnt find out about it or doesnt think its worth engaging with. Thank god for that at least.

answers.description: Deep breaths here, deep breaths. Lets just issue a statement here regarding the mess, denouncing the unnecessary involvement of the Church in politics. This doesnt have to blow up unless we let it.
answers.feedback: You seem to have let it - the story is amplified by the Campaigns statement, and the murmuring of Jacks faith influencing him get louder.

answers.description: Oh lord, give me strength. Jack, shake hands with any Protestant you can. Stress the separation of the Church and the State. Just bury the damn story!
answers.feedback: The story doesnt blow up, thank god. But some Catholics may be deflated by this attempts to downplay Catholicism.

questions.description: While you have a lot of affection for Scoop, its undeniable that hes not exactly an exemplary campaigner. How should his talents be best used?

answers.description: Honestly, I dont get why people arent into him. Everyone that meets him likes the guy. Lets have him stick to one on ones with on the fence Democrats and labor leaders.
answers.feedback: Scoop is already fairly popular with these figures, but he should help boost turnout nonetheless.

answers.description: Jack was telling me, they call him the Senator from Boeing. That seems unfair to me, but theres probably some truth to it. Sounds like he could handle some lobbyists for extra funds.
answers.feedback: Jacks military plans are a lot more appealing than Nixons at least.The funds he secures should help fund another massive deployment of ads throughout the west.

answers.description: Maybe he struggles with crowds. What if he recorded some ads of him delivering policy, and used those to get people behind him. That should help matters.
answers.feedback: Jackson delivers a wonky, policy driven 30 second spiel that bores everyone who sees it. Policy driven voters should approve at least

answers.description: You know, they tried to primary him back in Washington, and he won massively every time. Have him stick to his home state, and keep it blue.
answers.feedback: Washington likes Ike, and it certainly seems likely to slip into Nixons pocket. Scoops efforts should ensure that the nine electoral votes are Jacks. Its not a lot, but with the election promising to be so close, you need every guarantee you can get.

questions.description: Despite your distaste for the man, it cant be denied that Johnson has been an excellent choice as Jacks running mate. Hes been a vigorous campaigner and flexed as much influence over Southern states as he can. With the campaign coming to a close, where should he focus his efforts?

answers.description: Texas is still too close for my liking. He has that whole radio thing down there? Have him really plunge it into overdrive in Texas.
answers.feedback: Johnson is already throwing his weight there, but some more shouldnt hurt. An unfortunate incident emerges when a Republican congressman leads an anti-Johnson protest, and poor Lady Bird Johnson is attacked. Unfortunate for Nixon, at least.

answers.description: Lyndon is mean, bitter, vicious - an animal in many ways. But he's an animal we can let off the leash. Have him really pile on Nixon. Hes vulnerable on a lot of levels, but hiding behind Ike. Let Johnson get his name muddy and slam him on everything.
answers.feedback: The 1952 funding scandal , the ties with McCarthy, his general unlikeability - Nixon is a big target, and Johnson is naturally an aggressive campaigner. Nixons repressed rage as he tries to laugh Johnsons attacks off are highlights of the campaign.

answers.description: Hes done a very impressive job handling the unpledged electors movement, but I think theres some more he can do. Have him speak to Governor Patterson, and have him free up the Alabama electors. If hes as great as he acts, it should be a breeze.
answers.feedback: Johnson calls Jack from Alabama, telling him that as President hell need to sign off on about $5 million for Alabamas infrastructure. The famous Johnson treatment '

answers.description: Lets have him break bread with Meaney and Reuther, and lay his whole anti-union thing to bed.
answers.feedback: In an excruciatingly awkward meeting, Johnson meekly offers up excuses for his past votes while being grilled by Meaney and Reuther. They dont seem satisfied, but watching Johnson squirm may be worth it.

questions.description: With blood, sweat, and tears, you've reached the last fateful week of the campaign. Through a haze of painkillers, Jack hears you recommend his last campaign stops.

answers.description: How about the West? You're loved in Hollywood - that's got to translate to something.
answers.feedback: "Alright, Bobby."

answers.description: Our transformative programme threatens them, so we have to reassure the South. The heat should be downright manageable this time of year.
answers.feedback: "Alright, Bobby."

answers.description: We're lost without the Midwest, Jack. We've got to shore up these unionmen - once and for all.
answers.feedback: "Alright, Bobby."

answers.description: A victory lap through the East sounds good, right Jack? It's our coast - we've got to make sure of that.
answers.feedback: "Alright, Bobby."

questions.description: It's over, Bobby. You're in a hotel room, or campaign headquarters, or one of Dad's mansions - you could be in a Russian gulag, the way you feel watching the results. What'll be your last action of the campaign?

answers.description: Say a prayer.
answers.feedback: Our Father, Who art in heaven, hallowed be Thy name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

scenarioDescription:
After eight years of Dwight Eisenhower, two youthful candidates compete to be his successor. They will have to tackle issues such as civil rights, national defense, and the sluggish economy.

  • Vice President Nixon will have to stress the accompishments of the Eisenhower Administration, as well as press the issue of anti-communism while finding a way to handle his likeability issues.

  • Senator Kennedy will have to shore up his moderate credentials while not turning the left of his party off too much, while energising voters with a hawkish foreign policy.

    Nixon starts out with a decent lead, while Kennedy hopes to utilise his personal popularity and charisma to pull off an upset.
credits: The Brave Mujahadeen Warriors of Afghanistan
